data.description: The theory and principles of pattern making through flat pattern and draping techniques.
data.title: PATTERNMAKING FOR APPAREL DESIGN

data.description: Introduces the principles of sewn construction and addresses the physical and aesthetic properties of fiber and fabrics in the context of apparel design. The studios address skills necessary to plan and construct basic garments. Lectures, hands-on studios, and critiques explore the fundamentals of apparel structure and emphasize the interrelationship of fabric, design and apparel construction as well as the creative, expressive potential of materials and making.
data.title: SEWN CONSTRUCTION I

data.description: Emphasizes specialty fabrics, finishes and complex construction such as matching plaids and working with pile fabrics. Introduces pattern manipulation through basic flat patternmaking principles. Design and fabricate an original collection of garments for a target customer and will develop and construct two of the garments.
data.title: SEWN CONSTRUCTION II
